name: blushingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that causes someone to blush (= turn pink or red in the face, usually from embarrassment) or involves someone blushing: Asked if he thought she was pretty, he blushingly admitted that he did. At that time, custom required the bride to be blushingly coy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe older women paid him compliments which he blushingly received.Invited to speak about her achievements, she blushingly refused.Even 100 years later, her paintings can seem blushingly sexual. I blushingly confessed that I had not read any of the books.
